page.title: 08CLUBS IN OAKAMOOR AND ALTON
page.content: There is no commercial entertainment in the villages but people make their own. In both villages there is a Senior Citizens Association and Football, Cricket and Badminton Clubs.Darts, skittles,dominoes and crib are played in the pubs.The Lower Churnet Conservation Group and local Nature Conservation Trust Group meet once or twice a month for walks and talks and keep a watchful eye on the local environment and wildlife.Alton also has Brownies,Cubs,Guides,Scouts,a Youth Club,a Rounders Club and a Pigeon Club. There is a classical music and a folk group.Evening classes are held in Art, Dressmaking, Keep Fit and Dancing.The W.I. meets once a month.Oakamoor has a Pilots Club and Playgroup for children and bowls is played on Bolton's Sports Ground.Many annual events are run by various organisations.
